definition: to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
Raise the Red Lantern (1991), movie by Zhang Yimou 張藝謀|张艺谋[Zhang1 Yi4 mou2]
pinyin: Da4 hong2 Deng1 long2 Gao1 gao1 Gua4

definition: Zhu Hongdeng, one of the leaders of the Boxer Rebellion
The Legend of the Red Lantern

sentences.english: See, I stopped at the red traffic light, and I swear it never turned green!
sentences.chinese: 紅燈亮了，我踩了腳剎車，誰知道那燈再沒變綠過。

sentences.english: After the yellow light, a red light appears for left-turning vehicles only.
sentences.chinese: 轉左方向的黃燈之後，會有轉左的紅燈亮起。

sentences.english: In each new system, you can see it takes on a new meaning always with respect to whatever it is not.
sentences.chinese: 在每一個新的系統裏，在情人節點燈慶典上紅燈表示。

sentences.english: A city Laonongganzhao donkey, donkey Chuanghong Deng, fined 10 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 一老農趕著毛驢進城，驢闖紅燈，罰10元。

sentences.english: A clever man got an idea . He called up his fellow citizens to make red lanterns immediately .
sentences.chinese: 一個聰明人想了個辦法，讓大家趕快扎制紅燈。

sentences.english: Dongfang Shuo replied that the Fire God loved red lanterns more than anything.
sentences.chinese: 東方朔回答說火神最愛大紅燈籠。

sentences.english: The reason you have been stopped is that you just run a redlight .
sentences.chinese: 您被攔下的原因是，您剛剛闖紅燈。

sentences.english: When the red light was on, but there were no other vehicles, will you pass or stop?
sentences.chinese: 路口亮紅燈，但沒有車該不該過？

sentences.english: Oversee the introduction of additional red-light and speed enforcement camera systems.
sentences.chinese: 監督加設衝紅燈及超速攝影機系統的計劃。

sentences.english: Bright lights of high life expose people's weary looks.
sentences.chinese: 透過紅燈綠酒，映出人們的一臉倦容。

sentences.english: Function of under and upper thread auto detector , red light displayed on the thread broken position.
sentences.chinese: 底面線自動檢測功能，斷線位置亮紅燈顯示。

sentences.english: Amsterdam has a world-famous red-light district .
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特丹有一個世界聞名的紅燈區。

sentences.english: They come to a red light. The driver runs the red light.
sentences.chinese: 當他們遇到紅燈時，司機竟闖了過去。

sentences.english: I am not going to let saddness completely takes over me.
sentences.chinese: 人生道路上可能碰到的紅燈，我不去想。

sentences.english: I got a traffic ticket because I ran the red light.
sentences.chinese: 我收到了一張交通罰款單，因爲我闖了紅燈。

sentences.english: Out of the box the ONE does not included Speed and Red-light cameras.
sentences.chinese: 出於對票房的一個不包括速度和衝紅燈攝影機。

definition: car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
to turn/to go around a corner
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
